recipes.name: Pate Tarte Citron
recipes.description:
Put some butter with sifted powdered sugar. Beat it with a mixer until it turns white. After that, add the vanilla.
Then we add the eggs — however you like (your choice).
A pinch of salt.
Now, in a separate bowl, add the flour and baking powder.
Add half of the flour in one go, sifted.
Then gradually add the rest, bit by bit.
Let the dough rest, then shape it.

recipes.name: Creme au citron
recipes.description:
Separate the eggs
In a small bowl, crack one whole egg and add one egg yolk. Set aside.

Prepare the dry and wet base
In another large bowl, add the cornstarch first.
Then add the sugar on top.
Pour in the liquid lemon juice over the sugar.
Then add the water on top.

Combine
After everything is in, pour in the egg mixture and whisk until smooth.

Cook the mixture
Pour the mixture into a saucepan.
Set the heat to high (maximum).
Stir constantly with a whisk.
Once the mixture thickens and starts to bubble slightly, remove it immediately from the heat.

Add butter
Add a small piece of regular (not melted) butter to the hot mixture.
Stir until it melts completely and the cream is smooth.

Cool the lemon cream
Transfer the lemon cream to a clean bowl.
Cover it directly on contact with plastic wrap (so it touches the surface of the cream).
Let it cool at room temperature for 30 minutes, then refrigerate until cold.

Whip the Chantilly cream
In a cold bowl, add 100g of cold heavy cream.
Beat with a mixer on high speed until it becomes very fluffy and forms stiff peaks.

Add lemon flavor (optional)
Add a small amount of lemon concentrate.
Mix again just enough to fully incorporate the flavor — don’t overwhip.
Divide the whipped cream into 3 equal parts.
Gently fold in each part, one at a time, using a spatula.
Mix carefully to avoid adding air.
Stop once the texture is smooth, airy, and mousse-like.

Final steps — store or pipe

To use it right away, transfer to a piping bag. Let it sit a few minutes to cool slightly, then start piping.

To use it later, cover the mousse normally and store in the fridge until needed.
